title: SGA takes over in 2nd half as OKC stomps Wolves
content: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 20 of his 31 points in the second half and the top-seeded Thunder beat the Timberwolves 114-88 in Game 1.

title: Panthers cruise past Hurricanes in East opener
content: Carter Verhaeghe and Aaron Ekblad scored tone-setting first-period goals while Sergei Bobrovsky remained strong in net as the reigning Stanley Cup champion Panthers beat the Hurricanes on Tuesday night in Game 1.

title: Vikes' Jefferson dreams of winning Olympic gold
content: After NFL owners unanimously approved allowing the league's players to play flag football at the 2028 Olympics, Vikings star Justin Jefferson said the chance of winning a gold medal is "a dream."

title: Buehler tossed 3 innings into return; Cora, too
content: Red Sox right-hander Walker Buehler, just back from the 15-day injured list, was ejected from Boston's 2-0 win over the New York Mets in the third inning for arguing balls and strikes Tuesday, and moments later, manager Alex Cora was removed, as well.

title: Jeanty: OC wants me to ditch 'Halloween' stance
content: Raiders rookie Ashton Jeanty says that offensive coordinator Chip Kelly wants him to adjust his pre-snap stance.

title: Burrow: Another night game at Ravens 'isn't ideal'
content: Bengals quarterback Joe Burrow made a tongue-in-cheek suggestion for the NFL to give Cincinnati a home night game vs. the Ravens in 2026.

title: U.S. hockey star Knight says '26 Games her last
content: Hilary Knight, one of the most decorated players in women's hockey, told USA Today the 2026 Milan Winter Games will be her final Olympics.

title: 😲 MLB's most surprising teams so far
content: We offer an early postseason verdict on five of MLB's most surprising teams almost two months into the 2025 season.

title: NFL stars and Olympic flag football: Why some are hesitant
content: A vote Tuesday paved the way for players such as Patrick Mahomes and Tyreek Hill to play Olympic flag football.

title: WNBA Power Rankings: Minnesota on top, Golden State at the bottom in Week 1
content: Minnesota, New York and Indiana are 1-2-3 in Week 1, but which team climbed eight spots from our preseason rankings?

title: NBA conference finals: Everything to know about Knicks-Pacers, Thunder-Wolves series
content: With the NBA Finals just a round away, our experts break down how each team got here and what we are hearing about each series.

title: NBA conference finals horoscopes: Which teams are poised to ascend, and which will go in retrograde?
content: What does the Zodiac have to say about the Knicks, Thunder, Pacers and Wolves? Neil Paine shares his reading.

title: Chaos awaits in stacked SEC baseball tournament
content: For the very first time, all 16 SEC teams will get to participate in this year's conference baseball tournament.

title: No QBs allowed: We name the 25 best non-QB players for 2025
content: It's not all about quarterbacks. These players could have a big impact on 2025, even if they don't throw a pass.

title: Latest Bracketology: UConn emerges as a No. 1 seed for 2025-26
content: With Alex Karaban among the returning players, the Huskies crack the top line of our latest projected field.

title: Five fringe players who deserve a call-up for USMNT Gold Cup team
content: With results far from convincing, the USMNT needs fresh blood. Could these players get minutes at the Gold Cup?

title: Which Europa League finalist has had a worse season: Man United or Spurs?
content: Man United and Spurs have both had historically bad seasons but, somehow, one of them will win a European trophy and qualify for the Champions League.

title: Predicting Rounds 1 and 2 of the NBA draft after the combine
content: The draft could get interesting at No. 3. Here's how ESPN's Jonathan Givony and Jeremy Woo see it playing out.

title: How to bet tennis Grand Slams: The wagers you can make and ones to avoid
content: Tennis betting analyst Pam Maldonado reveals her strategies and tips for wagering on Grand Slam tournaments heading into the French Open.

title: Where things stand for each Ryder Cup team after two majors
content: Which players are locks to make each team? What tough decisions will captains Keegan Bradley and Luke Donald have to make? We break down how each team is shaping up.

title: NBA playoff futures: Thunder favored to win championship, followed by Knicks
content: An updated listing of the odds to win the NBA championship and Finals MVP heading into the conference finals.

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Panthers slight East favorites
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: Kinda, ex-Sporting Kansas City player, dies at 31
content: Former Sporting Kansas City midfielder Gadi Kinda died, his club Maccabi Haifa FC announced Tuesday. He was 31.

title: Poch: Turner risks being replaced as USMNT No. 1
content: USMNT head coach Mauricio Pochettino said that he is open to giving playing time to another goalkeeper besides incumbent Matt Turner in upcoming matches ahead of the 2026 World Cup.

title: City back in top 4 as KDB bids farewell to Etihad
content: Manchester City gave Kevin De Bruyne a victory in his final appearance at Etihad Stadium, as Omar Marmoush, Bernardo Silva and Nico Gonzalez scored in a 3-1 Premier League win over Bournemouth on Tuesday that saw them climb to third in the table.

title: Sources: Guimarães targeted by Saudi champs
content: Newcastle United midfielder Bruno Guimarães is in the sights of Al Ittihad over a potential €120 million ($135 million) transfer, sources confirmed to ESPN Brasil.

title: Rodri makes Man City return after ACL injury
content: Midfielder Rodri is back in the Manchester City squad for the first time since having surgery on his ACL in September.

title: Amorim: 'Hard to explain' pressure on Postecoglou
content: Ruben Amorim said it's "hard to explain" why he is not under the same pressure at Manchester United as his Tottenham counterpart Ange Postecoglou ahead of the Europa League final despite both teams suffering similarly miserable Premier League campaigns.

title: Sources: Clubs sue Liga MX for pro/rel return
content: Mexican second division clubs from the Liga de Expansión have filed a lawsuit against Liga MX and the Mexican Football Federation (FMF) regarding the return of promotion of relegation, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: United closing in on $83M Cunha deal
content: Manchester United are growing increasingly confident that they will land Matheus Cunha from Wolves this summer, sources have told ESPN.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid plot move for Williams
content: Will Nico Williams become the latest Galactico at Real Madrid? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Denver's biggest summer priority, plus offseason guides for every NBA team
content: NBA front office insider Bobby Marks breaks down the summer priorities and needs for every eliminated team.

title: Tamil Nadu sues Centre in Supreme Court over non-disbursal of ₹2,000-crore education funds
content: The State submits the lack of funds would affect 43,94,906 students, 2,21,817 teachers and 32,701 staff members in Tamil Nadu and also says Centre’s refusal to provide crucial funds linked to the State’s objection to the three-language formula of NEP-2020

title: Waqf (Amendment) Act hearing LIVE: Supreme Court to continue hearing on plea challenging Waqf Act
content: Underscoring the “presumption of constitutionality in favour of law”, the top court on May 20 said petitioners challenging the waqf law needed a “strong and glaring” case for interim relief

title: The 3-year rule: a setback to judiciary aspirants
content: The Supreme Court’s hope is that three years’ of practice may help future judges in addressing courtroom decorum, complex procedural cases and in understanding the perspectives of all stakeholders of the judicial system

title: Stand united in fight against terrorism: PM Modi in talks with new German Chancellor
content: The Ministry of External Affairs says that during the telephone conversation, the two leaders ‘reiterated their shared commitment to combating terrorism in all its forms’

title: Bengal CM Mamata disburses second tranche of Banglar Bari to 12 lakh beneficiaries
content: The Chief Minister highlights housing and welfare initiatives, targets BJP over tea garden promises in North Bengal

title: Murshidabad violence: Calcutta High Court-appointed panel says police were inactive at some places
content: Noting that the “main attack” occurred on the afternoon of April 11, the report by the three-member committee said “Local police were completely inactive and absent”

title: Jharkhand IAS officer Vinay Kumar Choubey arrested in excise scam, sent to judicial custody
content: Jharkhand IAS officer arrested in ₹38 crore money laundering case linked to excise scam, sparking demands for CBI probe

title: Rain lashes parts of Mumbai, more showers forecast in Maharashtra till May 24
content: Heavy rainfall and thunderstorm hit Mumbai, causing traffic disruptions, with more rain expected in Maharashtra in coming days

title: Kurnool-Vijayawada flight services to start from July 2
content: The flight services between the two cities would be available on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays initially. The services would run on daily basis from a later date.

title: Cabinet clears proposals to allot land to APIIC, Bhogapuram airport, recruitment of teachers
content: The Cabinet approved to shift the Potti Sreeramulu Telugu University from Hyderabad to Andhra Pradesh.

title: A.P. CM Naidu tells his Cabinet colleagues to refrain from commenting on liquor scam
content: Probe agencies should be given a free hand to do their job, he says; six-member Sub-Committee to monitor prices of farm produces and essential commodities.

title: TTD trust Board decides to increase green cover in Tirumala to 80%, improve infrastructure
content: The Trust Board gives nod to invite proposals for a master plan for developing temples at Tiruchanoor, Amaravati, Narayanavanam, Kapilatheertham, Nagalapuram, and Vontimitta

title: Kurma mela: The science of the mass nesting of Olive Ridley turtles
content: Olive Ridley turtles have endured mass extinctions, shifting continents, and rising seas. Their resilience is remarkable — but not limitless

title: Singareni aims for 76 mt coal production this year, asks young officers to fit into future plans
content: CMD N. Balaram asks young officers to aim bringing down coal price by at least ₹1K per tonne to be competitive by improving production, productivity

title: Banu Mushtaq wins International Booker Prize for Kannada short story collection ‘Heart Lamp’
content: Mushtaq described her win as a victory for diversity as she collected the prize at a ceremony at Tate Modern along with her translator Deepa Bhasthi

title: Promote harmony, study impact of AI on workers: SCO’s trade union leaders
content: The meeting of trade union leaders also decided to promote cultural exchanges among SCO member countries

title: Indian Youth Congress lodges FIR against Amit Malviya, Arnab Goswami
content: The move is for allegedly defaming the constitutional office of Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi and “spreading fake news”

title: Congress leader writes to President, seeks action against Maharashtra CS, DGP over protocol violation during CJI’s felicitation
content: Meanwhile, Maharashtra government on Tuesday issued protocol guidelines for the visit of the Chief Justice of India to Maharashtra

title: Madrasa students in Uttarakhand to study Operation Sindoor in their syllabus
content: Mufti Shamoon Qasmi, President of the Uttarakhand Madrasa Education Council, says the step is aimed at instilling a sense of patriotism among students of madrasas; the State has around 50,000 students in its 450-odd madrasas

title: Conditions favourable for advance of southwest monsoon:  RMC
content: Light to moderate rain is likely to occur over isolated places in Tamil Nadu, Puducherry and Karaikal area till May 26

title: After NMC’s show-cause notice, Bengal govt. passes ‘urgent order’ to medical college
content: The show-cause notice issued earlier this month flagged a total of eight ‘deficiencies’ in NRSMCH, including insufficient data surrounding faculty attendance, and bed occupancy

title: Road ahead to the crown: Miss World 2025 heads to grand finale with continental showdown
content: With the heritage and cultural tour of Telangana coming to an end, the contestants are now gearing up for the main event which will lead to the world getting a new Miss World

title: Gulzar Houz fire: Child Rights Commission inspects mishap site, calls out cramped, unsafe living
content: Commission chairperson Kothakota Seetha Dayakar Reddy described the incident as “shocking and deeply distressing”, and lamented the loss of young lives

title: Miss World 2025 contestants advocate for breast cancer awareness
content: The visit focussed on encouraging contestants to engage with meaningful social causes during the pageant’s India leg

title: Miss World 2025 finalists share vision for a better world at T-Hub
content: The contestants spoke on a wide range of pressing global and local issues, including child education, environment, paralysis, nature, support for young girls, mental health etc.

title: Waiver wire: NL Central southpaws lead top picks
content: Eric Karabell outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire and who you should be dropping from fantasy rosters.

title: Technopark-based AI platform claims to have thwarted cyberattacks during India-Pak stand-off
content: The AI-powered Web Application and API Protection (WAAP) platform, deployed across key sectors, played a vital role in countering cyberattacks aimed at disrupting major installations like airports and financial institutions

title: Transport operators in Bengal to go on three-day strike
content: They have called for the Chief Minister’s intervention as the ‘last hope’ to keep the State’s transport system operational

title: Rain brings relief to Vijayawada, administration on alert following IMD warning
content: A special Command Control Centre (CCC) has been set up at the Collectorate, and people have been asked not to stand under poles or trees during heavy rain or gales. For help, people can dial 9154 970 454

title: Suzuki Motorcycle India to set up a new plant in Haryana, invests ₹1,200 crore initially
content: The plant is scheduled to commence operations in 2027, further boosting SMIPL's production capabilities in India, the company said

title: Congress leaders are ‘poster boys’ of Pakistan: BJP
content: BJP MP Sambit Patra says Congress leaders, including Kharge and Rahul, are giving “oxygen” to Pakistan in its attempt to build a narrative against India

title: TMC, Shiv Sena (UBT) to join Centre’s diplomatic offensive against terror after call from Kiren Rijiju
content: Both changed their stance on multi-party delegations, which are part of the Narendra Modi government’s diplomatic offensive in the wake of the recent Indo-Pak conflict

title: Our forces hit roots of terror with great precision in Operation Sindoor, says Rajnath Singh
content: The Defence Minister says Indian forces brought the Pakistani Army to its knees in retaliatory action, when the adversary tried to launch an attack on Indian soil

title: 300 km of viaducts completed for Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train project
content: Project leverages indigenous technology; full-span method accelerates pace, supports ‘Make in India’

title: Supreme Court to hear Ashoka University professor’s plea against his arrest on May 21
content: The supplementary cause list for May 21, issued on Tuesday (May 20, 2025) evening, showed it listed before Justice Kant’s Bench

title: Modi’s foreign trips did not help India when it needed global support, says Kharge
content: Congress president claims India received no international backing in its efforts to expose Pakistan’s support for terrorism in the wake of the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor

title: All-party delegations head to global capitals to highlight impact of Pakistani cross-border terrorism
content: First three delegations to set out on May 21 to spotlight harm to India’s social harmony, development goals and present India’s doctrine of zero tolerance for terror; focus on UNSC members and future members

title: City Corporation’s empanelled shooters cull four wild boars at Kattaikonam
content: Recently, residents reported spotting wild boars at Kannamoola, Kazhakuttam, Kattaikonam, Chanthavila, and Kowdiar. Corporation formed a squad of empanelled shooters with licensed firearms to check menace

title: Manipur probe panel gets another extension
content: It has been asked to submit its report to the Centre as soon as possible but not later than November 20

title: Vellore, nearby districts take rain preparedness measures
content: District administrations of Ranipet, Tiruvannamalai, and Tirupattur instructed officials of various departments to inspect, strengthen bunds of irrigation tanks; equipment for rescue operations, and temporary relief camps have been kept ready

title: India, U.S. discuss carrier cooperation
content: A six-member U.S. delegation was in the national capital for the dialogue and visited defence establishments in Delhi and Goa

title: How Jayalalithaa gave up opposition to nuclear plant, citing Srinivasan’s report
content: After pitching for the Kudankulam project, the Chief Minister urged the Centre in September 2011 to halt it until apprehensions about its safety were addressed. Yet she set up an expert panel in February 2012. It included former Chairman of the Atomic Energy Commission M.R. Srinivasan. Based on its report, she green-lighted the plant in March

title: Justice E.V. Venugopal sets aside Endowment department’s notice to Bandi Sanjay’s Mahashakthi temple
content: Dharmakartha of the temple contended that the government cannot force him to register with the government as there were no hundials in the temple and no fees or charges were being collected from the devotees visiting the temple

title: Genetic study traces origin of Coorgis to three ancestral populations spanning millennia
content: The Kodavas Coorgis, while a socio-culturally homogenous community, have evoked considerable interest among anthropologists as their origins and demographic history are much debated

title: Telangana government tells IAS officers to maintain professionalism or face action
content: The memo was issued following several recent instances of IAS officers engaging in acts deemed unbecoming of their position

title: These newly built houses are a welcome relief for unsung heroes of elephant conservation
content: At the heart of the Theppakadu Elephant Camp in Udhagamandalam, a dedicated township has been created for mahout and ‘kavadi’ families that take care of the elephants. For ages, they lived in dilapidated houses. Rooted in the “cultural sensitivities” of the Adivasis, the new houses have been built with modern techniques and comforts

title: FSSAI calls for crackdown on illegal fruit ripening practices
content: States and Union Territories directed to enforce norms, inspect godowns and storage facilities for use of banned substances like calcium carbide

title: Day after SIT formed to probe his remarks, Madhya Pradesh Minister Vijay Shah skips key Cabinet meet
content: The meeting in Rajawada was in honour of 18th-century ruler Ahilyabai Holkar, whose 300th birth year was being commemorated with a series of events across the State

title: FUTA welcomes HC ruling, calls for V-C appointments in consultation with government
content: Forum terms HC verdict nullifying appointments made by Arif Mohammed Khan a victory for democratic ideals

title: Manipur’s flower festival starts on thorny note
content: Armed forces personnel were accused of obstructing a media team from Imphal on the way to the Shirui Lily Festival venue in Naga-dominated Ukhrul district

title: Heavy rain batters northern districts
content: Service roads of work-in-progress six-lane National Highways in Kannur, Kasaragod, Thrissur districts collapse or get flooded.

title: Indian Army says no air defence guns were deployed within Golden Temple
content: The clarification came following media reports on the deployment of air defence guns in the Golden Temple

title: Tamil Nadu spinning mills in a quandary over networking charges for rooftop solar energy plants
content: A recent circular by the Tamilnadu Power Distribution Corporation has asked the Superintending Engineers to continue levying network charges from all low tension and high tension consumers who use the grid for solar rooftops

title: Pre-monsoon showers continue to lash Bengaluru, but with lesser intensity
content: The IMD said that conditions are likely to become favourable for monsoon onset over Kerala during next four or five days.

title: MLA announces major development works in Ananatapur during Mini Mahanadu
content: Apart from clearing garbage, underground drainage works, along with the construction of the Nadimivanka protection wall to safeguard from flooding and inundation would be undertaken

title: All About Trump's Golden Dome Defence System, 1st US Weapon In Space
content: United States President Donald Trump on Tuesday unveiled new details on his plan for a missile defence system known as "Golden Dome", which is estimated to cost a total of some $175 billion.

title: "Utterly Intolerable": UK Pauses Israel Trade Talks Over West Bank Violence
content: The UK said it imposed sanctions that target what it classifies as the persistent cycle of serious violence undertaken by extremist Israeli settlers in the occupied West Bank and paused ongoing Free Trade Agreement negotiations with Israel.

title: Google Ramps Up AI Features In Search Engine
content: Google said it was beefing up online searches with even more generative artificial intelligence, as it presses on with embracing AI despite fears for its ad-based business model.

title: Migrant Detentions At Guantanamo Bay Cost $100,000 Per Person Daily
content: Donald Trump's use of the Guantanamo Bay naval base to house migrants appears to cost $100,000 per day for each detainee, US Senator Gary Peters said.

title: Trump Unveils $175 Billion 'Golden Dome' Missile Defence Plan For US
content: US President Donald Trump unveiled plans for a "Golden Dome" missile shield system on Tuesday to protect the country against attacks, saying it should be operational in about three years.

title: KCR Summoned By Judicial Commission On Kaleshwaram Irrigation Project
content: The judicial commission investigating alleged irregularities in the Kaleshwaram project in Telangana has summoned BRS president and former Chief Minister K Chandrasekhar Rao to appear before it as part of its ongoing inquiry.

title: Indian-Origin Entrepreneur Killed "Without Provocation" In Texas Public Bus
content: An Indian origin entrepreneur was fatally stabbed by another Indian man in a public bus in Texas, United States, police said.

title: This Is India's First Fully Literate State, 2011 Census Had Ranked It At 3
content: Chief Minister Lalduhoma on Tuesday declared Mizoram as the country's first fully literate state. Lalduhoma announced the presence of Union Minister of State for Education Jayant Chaudhary at a function in Mizoram University (MZU).

title: Army Denies Deploying Air Defence Guns At Golden Temple During Op Sindoor
content: The Army said on Tuesday that no air defence guns or any other air defence resources were deployed within the Golden Temple premises during Operation Sindoor.

title: Kannada Writer Banu Mushtaq Wins International Booker Prize For 'Heart Lamp'
content: Writer, activist and lawyer Banu Mushtaq's short story collection 'Heart Lamp' on Tuesday night became the first Kannada title to win the coveted GBP 50,000 International Booker Prize in London.

title: Rubio Says Thousands Of US Visas May Have Revoked As Crackdown Continues
content: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio said on Tuesday the number of visas he has revoked was probably in the thousands, adding that he believed there was still more to do.

title: Comic Actor George Wendt, 'Cheers' Barfly Named Norm, Dies At 76
content: Comic actor George Wendt, best known for his Emmy-nominated supporting role as the beer-bellied barfly Norm on the long-running hit NBC television sitcom "Cheers," died on Tuesday in Los Angeles. He was 76.

title: Maharashtra Reports 52 Covid Cases, 2 Deaths Since January: Health Office
content: Maharashtra has reported two COVID-19-related deaths since January this year, the state health department said on Tuesday.

title: US Intel Suggests Israel Preparing Strike On Iran's Nuclear Sites: Reports
content: New intelligence obtained by the United States suggests that Israel is preparing to strike Iranian nuclear facilities, CNN reported on Tuesday, citing multiple U.S. officials familiar with the matter.

title: Days After Trump Praises Former Al Qaeda Terrorist, An Old Video Goes Viral
content: Less than a week after Donald Trump scripted history by rubbing shoulders with former Al Qaeda and ISIS terrorist, now Syrian President, Ahmad al-Sharaa, an old video of the latter has surfaced online, where he is seen expressing happiness over 9/11.

title: Italy PM Says Pope Confirmed Willingness To Host Ukraine Peace Talks
content: Italy's Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said Tuesday that Pope Leo XIV confirmed to her the Vatican's willingness to host peace talks between Russia and Ukraine.

title: Biden Never Diagnosed With Prostate Cancer Before: Spokesperson
content: Joe Biden had never been diagnosed with prostate cancer before last week and previously had a blood test for the disease 11 years ago, a spokesperson for the former US president said Tuesday.

title: Maharashtra's Palghar Collector Office Receives Fake Bomb Threat Email
content: The collector's office in Maharashtra's Palghar received a bomb threat email in the early hours of Tuesday, prompting the police to evacuate the premises, officials said.

title: Two Arrested For Hacking Websites, Posting Anti-India Message In Gujarat
content: The Gujarat Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) has caught two persons, including a minor, for allegedly hacking Indian websites and posting anti-India messages online, officials said on Tuesday.

title: Ahead Of Indian Astronaut's Space Odyssey, A Global Outreach
content: India and the US are using the upcoming NASA-ISRO joint flight of an Indian astronaut to space as a big outreach activity between the world's oldest and world's largest democracies.

title: 'Journey full of love': Diary of 'spy' YouTuber painted 'rosy picture' of Pak
content: YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra, known for her cross-border travel videos, has been arrested on charges of spying for Pakistan. Haryana Police are scrutinizing her personal diary, revealing pro-Pakistan sentiments and contacts with Pakistani operatives. Investigators allege Malhotra shared sensitive information via encrypted platforms, using aliases to evade detection.

title: 'From bullock carts to global stage': Banu Mushtaq wins International Booker Prize
content: Banu Mushtaq, a Kannada writer, has won the International Booker Prize 2025 for her short story collection, Heart Lamp, translated by Deepa Bhasthi. This marks the first time a short story collection has received this honor. The judging panel praised the work's radical translation and uplifting narratives, blending Kannada roots with socio-political themes.

title: Maturity beyond age: Suryavanshi's heroic vs CSK shows he is not a fluke
content: Rajasthan Royals batting coach Vikram Rathour admits he was "sold" on Vaibhav Suryavanshi's talent after seeing him bat for the first time. The 14-year-old phenom further solidified that impression with a mature 33-ball 57 against CSK, anchoring a vital partnership. Rathour lauded Suryavanshi's temperament under pressure, suggesting his unique style and ability make him a truly special prospect.

title: Andheri subway shut, roads flooded, traffic crawls: Rain throws Mumbai into chaos
content: Mumbai experienced heavy pre-monsoon showers on Tuesday evening, with Jogeshwari receiving the highest rainfall at 63mm. The IMD forecasts thunderstorms, lightning, and gusty winds up to 60kmph for Mumbai, Thane, Raigad, and Palghar districts throughout the week. Waterlogging shut down the Andheri subway, causing traffic congestion. Raigad is expected to face very heavy rainfall on Thursday and Friday.

title: BJP MP in Karnataka makes 'Work from Home' request to Infosys & other IT companies
content: Following heavy rainfall in Bengaluru, BJP MP PC Mohan urged IT companies like Infosys to allow work from home. Cognizant has already asked its Bengaluru employees to work from home. The city experienced the second-highest rainfall in a day since 2011, disrupting daily life and leading to the temporary closure of a section of Hosur Road due to waterlogging.

title: 'False campaign': Congress files FIR against BJP's Amit Malviya, Arnab Goswami
content: The Congress party has filed a police complaint against BJP IT cell head Amit Malviya and Republic TV's Arnab Goswami, accusing them of spreading misinformation. The FIR, lodged in Bengaluru, alleges that Malviya and Goswami falsely claimed the Istanbul Congress Centre is the Indian National Congress's office.

title: MS Dhoni brutally roasted as netizens ask for IPL retirement
content: Chennai Super Kings face a potential last-place finish in IPL 2025, intensifying scrutiny on MS Dhoni, who returned as captain mid-season. Despite Dhoni's decent batting performance, CSK's struggles, including overseas players' underperformance and veterans' poor form, have led to defeats. A loss to Rajasthan Royals further compounded their woes, increasing pressure ahead of their final game against Gujarat Titans.

title: Denmark's largest construction company returns keys of Tesla cars
content: Danish construction firm Tscherning has divested its entire Tesla fleet, citing Elon Musk's political stances as the primary reason. This decision mirrors a broader trend in Europe, where Tesla's brand image and sales are suffering due to consumer concerns over Musk's political affiliations. The company is opting for European alternatives, highlighting the impact of political views on corporate purchasing decisions.

title: Trump says Biden's 'cognitive decline' was exploited to let criminals into US
content: Donald Trump accused the Biden administration of treason for an open-border policy, alleging it allowed criminals into the US due to Biden's cognitive decline. Trump claimed it was Biden's staff who implemented the policy, deliberately undermining the country and costing billions. He warned of severe consequences for these actions, accusing them of stealing the presidency.

title: Dhoni's CSK just hit record low no one thought was possible
content: Rajasthan Royals defeated Chennai Super Kings by six wickets, chasing down 188 at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. Vaibhav Suryavanshi's impressive 57 off 33 balls and Yashasvi Jaiswal's quick 36 set the stage for the victory. CSK's batting inconsistency, despite Ayush Mhatre's 43, led to their fifth loss while defending a total, increasing the risk of finishing last.

title: Internet reacts after 14-yo Vaibhav Suryavanshi touches MS Dhoni's feet
content: Following Rajasthan Royals' victory over Chennai Super Kings, young batting sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi, known for his record-breaking century, displayed remarkable respect by touching MS Dhoni's feet. This heartwarming gesture resonated deeply with fans, overshadowing the match's playoff implications. Suryavanshi's humility and talent continue to impress, marking him as a rising star in cricket.

title: Who is Indian-origin executive Vaibhav Taneja? Tesla CFO earns a record $139m salary
content: Vaibhav Taneja, Tesla's CFO, has garnered attention with his extraordinary $139.5 million compensation for 2024, primarily from stock options, surpassing tech leaders like Satya Nadella and Sundar Pichai. Taneja's journey from Delhi University to Wall Street, including roles at PwC and SolarCity, culminated in his current position, where he navigates Tesla's financial strategy amid market challenges.

title: 'I would've loved to see Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma play more'
content: Indian cricket faces a significant transition as Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma, and Ravichandran Ashwin retire from Test cricket. Vikram Rathour acknowledges their immense contributions and respects their decisions. Ashwin reflects on their careers, highlighting Kohli's aggression and Rohit's potential. Meanwhile, young Vaibhav Suryavanshi shines in the IPL, scoring a match-winning half-century for Rajasthan Royals.

title: Dhoni warns young batters: 'If you're looking for 200-plus SR then ... '
content: MS Dhoni advised young Indian batters like Vaibhav Suryavanshi to maintain consistency and stay calm under pressure. Despite CSK's loss to RR, Dhoni acknowledged early wickets put pressure on the team. Sanju Samson praised Suryavanshi's mature innings and game awareness, highlighting his promising future and the coaching staff's role in developing young talents.

title: May consider new sanctions on Russia if peace talks stall: US
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio defended President Trump's Ukraine policy, asserting that Russia had not gained any concessions. This statement countered Senator Jeanne Shaheen's criticism that Trump's actions emboldened Putin. Rubio indicated that sanctions might be necessary if Russia continued military operations and showed no interest in peace negotiations, while Trump expressed confidence in Putin's desire for peace.

title: New law designed to rob Muslims of religious rights over waqf: Kapil Sibal
content: When the CJI said courts prima facie presume a law enacted by Parliament to be valid, Sibal said Waqf Amendment Act was discriminatory as it had singled out the Muslim community by mandating that a waqif has to be a practising Muslim for five years to be entitled to donate his properties for waqf. "Has any other religious denomination been mandated by law to ask the same question to anyone making an endowment for charitable purposes?" he asked.

title: Heart Lamp by Banu Mushtaq wins International Booker Prize 2025
content: Banu Mushtaq, a Kannada writer, has been awarded the International Booker Prize 2025 for her short story collection, Heart Lamp. Deepa Bhasthi translated the book from Kannada to English. After becoming the first Kannada author to win the International Booker Prize, Banu told TOI: “This prize shows the true potential of the Kannada language, its literature, and the possibilities ahead if more works are translated into other languages, especially English.”

title: ONGC, Jubilant & more: Stock recommendations for today
content: Stock market recommendations: Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers' Mehul Kothari recommends buying Chennai Petro, Jubilant Pharmova, and ONGC. Chennai Petro shows a breakout with a target of ₹870, while Jubilant Pharmova indicates bullish momentum targeting ₹1060. ONGC has reclaimed its 200 DEMA, suggesting strength with a short-term target of ₹260.

title: George Wendt dies at 76: Social media remembers the ‘Cheers’ star
content: George Wendt, celebrated for his iconic role as Norm Peterson on Cheers, passed away peacefully at 76 on May 20, 2025. His portrayal of the affable bar regular earned him six Emmy nominations and a permanent place in television history. Wendt's Cheers co-stars, including Ted Danson and Rhea Perlman, fondly remembered him.

title: SC to petitioners on waqf law: Need 'strong and glaring' case for interim relief
content: The Supreme Court has asked petitioners challenging the waqf laws to present a compelling case for interim relief, emphasizing the presumption of constitutionality for statutes. Petitioners argue the law enables systematic expropriation of waqf properties, dilutes Muslim representation, and restricts legal remedies.

title: 'Police inactive and absent': What are key findings of HC-appointed panel on Murshidabad violence
content: A Calcutta high court-appointed committee has revealed significant failures by local authorities during the Murshidabad violence in Dhulian, pinpointing a local councillor's involvement in orchestrating the attacks on April 11. The report highlights the complete absence and inactivity of the local police during the unrest. Victims require tailored rehabilitation packages and appropriate compensation.

title: Bill Belichick’s girlfriend Jordon Hudson reportedly told someone they are engaged
content: Bill Belichick and Jordon Hudson's relationship has captured public attention, and recent reports suggest they may be engaged. While neither Belichick nor Hudson have confirmed the news, fans have reacted strongly, expressing concerns about the couple's future and Belichick's assets. Belichick recently praised Hudson for her support, but the engagement rumors remain unconfirmed.

title: 10 minutes of fury: How Army flattened Pak posts after attack on civilians
content: Following Pakistan's ceasefire violation on May 7-8, the Indian Army retaliated swiftly along the LoC, destroying multiple Pakistani forward posts within 10 minutes using MMGs. Operation Sindoor was launched after the Pahalgam terror attack. An Indian soldier reported heavy casualties inflicted and bunkers destroyed. Pakistan then targeted civilian areas and attempted drone strikes, which were also neutralised by India.

title: IPL: Suryavanshi, Jurel and bowlers lead RR to six-wicket win over CSK
content: Rajasthan Royals capped off their IPL 2025 season with a commanding six-wicket victory over Chennai Super Kings. Despite a brief middle-overs wobble, brilliant half-century from Vaibhav Suryavanshi and a blistering finish from Dhruv Jurel, coupled with a disciplined bowling effort led by Akash Madhwal, ensured the Royals chased down 188 with 17 balls to spare, ending their campaign on a high.

title: QB tiers for every FBS program: Returning stars and, of course, Arch Manning

title: NBA playoffs: Experts' picks for Pacers-Knicks
content: no. 1 seed Oklahoma City Thunder advanced to the Western Conference finals . it is the Thunder's first trip to the conference finals since the 2015-16 campaign . the Minnesota Timberwolves rolled into the West finals after taking care of the Golden State Warriors in five games .

title: Stanley Cup conference finals preview: Goalie confidence ratings, X factors for NHL's final four
content: the 2025 Stanley Cup playoffs field is down to the final four . the Carolina Hurricanes and the Florida Panthers face off in a rematch of the 2023 Eastern Conference finals . a return bout from 2024 between the Dallas Stars and Edmonton Oilers will be the Stanley Cup final .

title: Early look at the Stars-Oilers matchup in the Western Conference finals
content: the Western Conference finals matchup is set for 2025 . the Dallas Stars and Edmonton Oilers are poised to square off to determine which club will represent the West in the Stanley Cup Final . we're here with key intel from ESPN Research, wagering info from ESPN BET and more .

title: NBA conference finals takeaways: Gilgeous-Alexander leads Thunder to win over Wolves
content: the 2025 NBA Conference Finals has tipped off . only four teams remain in the postseason, all fighting for a chance to represent their conference in the finals . the no. 1 seed Oklahoma City Thunder beat the Denver Nuggets in Game 1 .

title: Fever fail to handle Dream's 'physicality' in loss
content: the Atlanta Dream went 5-1 against the WNBA last season . the dream also have a new coach this season in Karl Smesko . it's unclear what opponents will try to do against the Fever in a playoff series .
